00016 // Globals
00017 static t_class          *s_hub_class;                                           // Required: Global pointer for our class
00018 static t_object         *s_jcom_send_notifications = NULL;      // Shared instance for communicating about module instantiation and deletion
00019 
00023 struct _subIsLess : binary_function<t_subscriber*, t_subscriber*, bool> {
00024         bool operator()(const t_subscriber* p, const t_subscriber* q)
00025                 {       return jcom_core_string_compare(p->name->s_name, q->name->s_name); }
00026 } subscriberIsLess;

00029 /************************************************************************************/
00030 // Main() Function
00031 
00032 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00033 {
00034         long attrflags = 0;
00035         t_class *c;
00036         t_object *attr;
00037         
00038         // Initialize Globals
00039         jamoma_init();
00040 
00041         // Define our class
00042         c = class_new("jcom.hub",(method)hub_new, (method)hub_free, (short)sizeof(t_hub), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00043         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_hub, obex));
00044         
00045         // Make methods accessible for our class:
00046         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_symbol,                          "anything",                                     A_GIMME, 0L);
00047 
00048         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_getobj_audioin,          "getobj_audioin",                       A_CANT, 0);             // return a pointer to the jcom.in~ object
00049         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_getobj_audioout,         "getobj_audioout",                      A_CANT, 0);             // return a pointer to the jcom.out~ object
00050 
00051         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_bang,                            "bang",                                         0);                             // bang is used by one of the ramp driving mechanisms to calculate values
00052 
00053         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_subscribe,                       "subscribe",                            A_CANT, 0L);    // client object subscribing
00054         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_unsubscribe,                     "unsubscribe",                          A_CANT, 0L);    // client object unsubscribing
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_receive,                         "feedback",                                     A_GIMME, 0L);   // feedback from parameters and such
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_private,                         "private",                                      A_GIMME, 0L);   // internal communications such as jcom.remote
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_return,                          "return",                                       A_GIMME, 0L);   // feedback from jcom.return
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_return_extended,         "return_extended",                      A_GIMME, 0L);   // feedback from jcom.return
00059 
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_paramnames_get,          "/parameter_names/dump",        0L);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_messagenames_get,        "/message_names/dump",          0L);
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_returnnames_get,         "/return_names/dump",           0L);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_allnames_get,            "/*_names/dump",                        0L);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_paramvalues_get,         "/parameter_values/dump",       0L);
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_modulename_get,          "/module_name/get",                     0L);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)core_modulename_get,         "core_module_name/get",                 0L);
00067         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_algorithmtype_get,       "/algorithm_type/get",          A_CANT);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_init,                            "/init",                                        0L);
00069         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_autodoc,                         "/documentation/generate",      A_DEFSYM, 0L);
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_module_view_alg,         "/module/view_internals",       0L);
00071         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_read,                     "/preset/read",                         A_DEFSYM, 0L);
00072         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_write,            "/preset/write",                        A_DEFSYM, 0L);  // number or name
00073         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_recall,           "/preset/recall",                       A_GIMME, 0L);   // number or name
00074         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_copy,                     "/preset/copy",                         A_GIMME, 0L);   // number or name
00075         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_store,            "/preset/store",                        A_GIMME, 0L);   // number & optional name
00076         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_store_next,       "/preset/storenext",            A_GIMME, 0L);
00077         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_default,          "/preset/default",                      0L);
00078         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_preset_default,          "/presets/clear",                       0L);
00079         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_presets_dump,            "/preset/post",                         0L);
00080         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_ui_freeze,                       "/ui/freeze",                           A_LONG, 0L);
00081         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_ui_refresh,                      "/ui/refresh",                          0L);
00082         
00083         class_addmethod(c, (method)hub_assist,                          "assist",                                       A_CANT, 0L); 
00084     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,             "dumpout",                                      A_CANT, 0);
00085     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref",                                     A_CANT, 0);
00086 
00087         // ATTRIBUTE: name
00088         attr = attr_offset_new("name", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00089                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_name));
00090         class_addattr(c, attr);
00091         
00092         // ATTRIBUTE: module_type       [audio, video, control, etc.]
00093         attr = attr_offset_new("module_type", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00094                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_type));
00095         class_addattr(c, attr);
00096 
00097         // ATTRIBUTE: size [1U, 2U, 3U 1U-half, etc.]
00098         attr = attr_offset_new("size", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00099                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_size));
00100         class_addattr(c, attr);
00101 
00102         // ATTRIBUTE: skin ['default', etc.]
00103         attr = attr_offset_new("skin", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00104                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_skin));
00105         class_addattr(c, attr);
00106         
00107         // ATTRIBUTE: algorithm_type [poly, blue, none, control, jitter, video, default, etc.]
00108         attr = attr_offset_new("algorithm_type", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00109                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_algorithm_type));
00110         class_addattr(c, attr);
00111         
00112         // ATTRIBUTE: description
00113         attr = attr_offset_new("description", _sym_symbol, attrflags,
00114                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_description));
00115         class_addattr(c, attr);
00116                         
00117         // ATTRIBUTE: inspector
00118         attr = attr_offset_new("inspector", _sym_long, attrflags,
00119                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_hub, attr_inspector));
00120         class_addattr(c, attr);
00121 
00122         // Finalize our class
00123         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00124         s_hub_class = c;
00125         
00126         return 0;
00127 }

00130 /************************************************************************************/
00131 // Object Life
00132 
00133 void *hub_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00134 {
00135         short                   i;
00136         long                    attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);
00137         t_hub                   *x = (t_hub *)object_alloc(s_hub_class);
00138         t_symbol                *name = _sym_nothing;
00139         t_atom                  a[2];
00140         
00141         if(attrstart && argv)
00142                 atom_arg_getsym(&name, 0, attrstart, argv);
00143         else
00144                 name = symbol_unique();
00145 
00146         if(x){
00147                 for(i=k_num_outlets; i > 0; i--)
00148                         x->outlets[i-1] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00149                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (t_object *)x->outlets[k_outlet_dumpout]);
00150                 x->init_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)hub_qfn_init);
00151 
00152                 // set default attributes
00153                 x->attr_name = name;
00154                 x->osc_name = _sym_nothing;
00155                 x->attr_type = ps_control;
00156                 x->attr_description = _sym_nothing;
00157                 x->attr_algorithm_type = ps_default;            // poly for audio, jitter for video, control for control
00158                 x->attr_skin = ps_default;                                      // default tells the gui constructor js to choose for us
00159                 x->attr_size = ps_1U_half;
00160                 x->attr_inspector = 0;
00161                 x->using_wildcard = false;
00162                 x->in_object = NULL;                                            // module MUST have a jcom.in object
00163                 x->out_object = NULL;                                           // the jcom.out object is optional
00164                 x->gui_object = NULL;                                           // jcom.remote in the gui
00165                 x->num_parameters = 0;
00166                 for(i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00167                         x->meter_object[i] = NULL;
00168                 x->preview_object = NULL;
00169                 
00170                 x->preset = new presetList;                                     // begin with no presets
00171                 x->subscriber = new subscriberList;                     // ... and no subscribers
00172                 
00173                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                       // handle attribute args
00174                 
00175                 x->jcom_send = NULL;
00176                 x->jcom_receive = NULL;
00177                 x->jcom_send_broadcast = NULL;
00178                 atom_setsym(a, ps_jcom_remote_fromModule);
00179                 if(!jcom_core_loadextern(ps_jcom_send, 1, a, &x->jcom_send)) {
00180                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->attr_name->s_name);
00181                         error("jcom.hub: loading jcom.send extern failed!");
00182                 }
00183                 atom_setsym(a, ps_jcom_remote_toModule);
00184                 if(!jcom_core_loadextern(ps_jcom_receive, 1, a, &x->jcom_receive)) {
00185                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->attr_name->s_name);
00186                         error("jcom.hub: loading jcom.receive extern failed!");
00187                 }
00188                 else
00189                         object_method(x->jcom_receive, ps_setcallback, &hub_receive_callback, x);
00190                         
00191                 atom_setsym(a, ps_jcom_broadcast_fromHub);
00192                 if(!jcom_core_loadextern(ps_jcom_send, 1, a, &x->jcom_send_broadcast)) {
00193                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->attr_name->s_name);
00194                         error("jcom.hub: loading jcom.send (broadcast) extern failed!");
00195                 }
00196                 
00197                 if(!s_jcom_send_notifications){
00198                         atom_setsym(a, gensym("notifications"));
00199                         jcom_core_loadextern(ps_jcom_send, 1, a, &s_jcom_send_notifications);
00200                 }
00201                 
00202 #ifdef CREATE_INTERNALS
00203                 hub_internals_create(x);
00204 #endif
00205 
00206                 x->container = jamoma_object_getpatcher((t_object*)x);
00207                 defer_low(x, (method)hub_examine_context, 0, 0, 0);             
00208         }
00209         return x;
00210 }
00211 
00212 
00213 // TODO: When running in the debugger, it seems like we are iterating through this function a whole bunch of times!
00214 // Can we put it in a qelem or something so that it only gets called once? [TAP]
00215 // But actually, maybe it is just a Max 4.6 funky Runtime thing?  Let's take a look again when we get to Max 5
00216 void hub_examine_context(t_hub *x)
00217 {
00218         long                    argc = 0;
00219         t_atom                  *argv = NULL;
00220         char                    name[256];
00221         char                    *nametest;
00222         unsigned short  i;
00223         t_atom                  a[2];
00224         t_symbol                *context = jamoma_patcher_getcontext(x->container);
00225         t_max_err               err = MAX_ERR_NONE;
00226         int                             instance = 0;
00227 
00228         // Try to get OSC Name of module from an argument
00229         jamoma_patcher_getargs(x->container, &argc, &argv);     // <-- this call allocates memory for argv
00230         if(argc){
00231                 x->osc_name = atom_getsym(argv);
00232                 sysmem_freeptr(argv);
00233         }
00234         else
00235                 x->osc_name = _sym_nothing;
00236         
00237         // Try to get OSC Name of module from scripting name
00238         if(x->osc_name == _sym_nothing)
00239                 x->osc_name = jamoma_patcher_getvarname(x->container);
00240 
00241         // In this case we overwrite whatever happened above
00242         if(context == gensym("toplevel"))
00243                 x->osc_name = gensym("/editing_this_module");
00244                         
00245         // No arg is present -- try to invent something intelligent for a name
00246         if(x->osc_name == _sym_nothing){
00247                 post("%s: this module was not given an osc name as an argument!  making up something that will hopefully work.", x->attr_name->s_name);                         
00248                 x->osc_name = x->attr_name;
00249         }
00250 
00251         strcpy(name, x->osc_name->s_name);
00252         
00253         // the name is autoprepended with a /
00254         if(name[0] != '/'){
00255                 char newname[256];
00256                 
00257                 strcpy(newname, "/");
00258                 strcat(newname, name);
00259                 strcpy(name, newname);
00260         }
00261                 
00262         // search for illegal characters as specified by the OSC standard and replace them
00263         for(i=0; i<strlen(name); i++){
00264                 if(name[i] == '[')
00265                         name[i] = '.';
00266                 else if(name[i] == ']')
00267                         name[i] = 0;
00268         }
00269                 
00270         // if arg contains a slash then we must complain
00271         nametest = name + 1;
00272         if(strchr(nametest, '/'))
00273                 error("%s: OSC NAME GIVEN TO MODULES MAY NOT CONTAIN A SLASH OTHER THAN THE LEADING SLASH!", x->attr_name->s_name);
00274 again:
00275         x->osc_name = gensym(name);
00276         
00277         // Register with the framework, and making sure this name hasn't already been used...
00278         err = jamoma_hub_register(x->osc_name, (t_object *)x);
00279         if(err){
00280                 if(instance){
00281                         nametest = strrchr(name, '.');
00282                         if(nametest)
00283                                 *nametest = 0;
00284                 }
00285                 instance++;
00286                 nametest = name;
00287                 sprintf(name, "%s.%i", name, instance);
00288                 post("Jamoma cannot create multiple modules with the same OSC identifier (%s).  Trying %s instead.", x->osc_name->s_name, name);
00289                 err = MAX_ERR_NONE;
00290                 goto again;
00291         }
00292         
00293         // And send a notification to the environment
00294         atom_setsym(a, x->attr_name);
00295         atom_setsym(a+1, x->osc_name);
00296         object_method_typed(s_jcom_send_notifications, gensym("module.new"), 2, a, NULL);
00297 
00298         // Finally, we now tell subscribers (parameters, etc.) to subscribe
00299         if(x->jcom_send_broadcast)
00300                 object_method_typed(x->jcom_send_broadcast, gensym("hub.changed"), 0, NULL, NULL);
00301 }
00302 
00303 
00304 void hub_free(t_hub *x)
00305 {
00306         subscriberIterator i;
00307         subscriberList *subscriber = x->subscriber;
00308         t_atom a[2];
00309 
00310         jamoma_hub_remove(x->osc_name);
00311 
00312         atom_setsym(a, x->attr_name);
00313         atom_setsym(a+1, x->osc_name);
00314         object_method_typed(s_jcom_send_notifications, gensym("module.removed"), 2, a, NULL);
00315 
00316         critical_enter(0);
00317         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00318                 // notify the subscriber that the hub is going away
00319                 object_method((*i)->object, ps_release);
00320                 sysmem_freeptr(*i);
00321         }
00322         critical_exit(0);       
00323 
00324         hub_presets_clear(x);
00325         qelem_free(x->init_qelem);
00326         if(x->jcom_send)
00327                 object_free(x->jcom_send);
00328         if(x->jcom_receive)
00329                 object_free(x->jcom_receive);
00330         if(x->jcom_send_broadcast)
00331                 object_free(x->jcom_send_broadcast);
00332         x->subscriber->clear();
00333 #ifdef CREATE_INTERNALS
00334         hub_internals_destroy(x);
00335 #endif
00336         delete x->subscriber;
00337         delete x->preset;
00338 }

00340 
00341 /************************************************************************************/
00342 // Communication with jcom.param objects
00343 
00344 // This method is called from clients such as jcom.parameter to register it with this hub
00345 t_symbol* hub_subscribe(t_hub *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *subscriber_object, t_symbol *type)
00346 {
00347         t_subscriber    *new_subscriber;
00348         
00349         if(subscriber_object == NULL){
00350                 if (x->osc_name == gensym("/editing_this_module"))
00351                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->attr_name->s_name);
00352                 else    
00353                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->osc_name->s_name);
00354                 error("Null object cannot subscribe to jcom.hub");
00355                 return _sym_nothing;
00356         }
00357         
00358         // Create the new item
00359         new_subscriber = (t_subscriber *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_subscriber));
00360         new_subscriber->object = subscriber_object;
00361         new_subscriber->name = name;
00362         new_subscriber->type = type;
00363 
00364         critical_enter(0);
00365         // Merge new subscriber into subscriber list sorted alphabetically
00366         x->subscriber->merge(new_subscriber, subscriberIsLess);
00367 
00368         // special cases and other caching
00369         if(new_subscriber->type == ps_subscribe_in){
00370                 x->in_object = (t_object*)subscriber_object;
00371                 if(x->out_object){              // set up pointers between jcom.in and jcom.out
00372                         object_method(x->in_object, ps_link_out, x->out_object);
00373                         object_method(x->out_object, ps_link_in, x->in_object);
00374                 }
00375         }
00376         if(new_subscriber->type == ps_subscribe_out){
00377                 x->out_object = (t_object*)subscriber_object;
00378                 if(x->in_object){               // set up pointers between jcom.in and jcom.out
00379                         object_method(x->in_object, ps_link_out, x->out_object);
00380                         object_method(x->out_object, ps_link_in, x->in_object);
00381                 }
00382                 for(int i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++)
00383                         object_method(x->out_object, ps_register_meter, i, x->meter_object[i]);
00384                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_register_preview, x->preview_object);
00385         }
00386 
00387         if(new_subscriber->type == ps_subscribe_remote){
00388                 int meternum = 0;
00389                 sscanf( new_subscriber->name->s_name, "__meter__%i", &meternum);
00390                 if(meternum > 0){
00391                         x->meter_object[meternum-1] = (t_object*)new_subscriber->object;
00392                         if(x->out_object)
00393                                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_register_meter, meternum-1, x->meter_object[meternum-1]);
00394                 }
00395                 else if(new_subscriber->name == ps___preview__){
00396                         x->preview_object = new_subscriber->object;
00397                         if(x->out_object)
00398                                 object_method(x->out_object, ps_register_preview, x->preview_object);                           
00399                 }
00400         }
00401         
00402         if(new_subscriber->type == ps_subscribe_parameter)
00403                 x->num_parameters++;
00404         if(new_subscriber->name == ps__gui__)
00405                 x->gui_object = subscriber_object;
00406         critical_exit(0);
00407         
00408         qelem_unset(x->init_qelem);             // clear the last thing to make sure we don't call into this a bunch of times
00409         qelem_set(x->init_qelem);               // flag the queue for initialization
00410         return x->attr_name;                    // return the module name to the parameter
00411 }
00412 
00413 
00414 void hub_unsubscribe(t_hub *x, t_object *subscriber_object)
00415 {
00416         subscriberList  *subscribers = x->subscriber;
00417         
00418         // Search the linked list for this object and remove it
00419         t_subscriber* t;
00420         critical_enter(0);
00421         for(subscriberIterator item = subscribers->begin(); item != subscribers->end(); ++item) {
00422                 t = *item;
00423                 
00424                 if(t->object == subscriber_object) {
00425                         if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter)
00426                                 x->num_parameters--;
00427                         else if(t->type == ps_subscribe_in){
00428                                 if(x->out_object)
00429                                         object_method(x->out_object, ps_unlink_out);
00430                         }
00431                         else if(t->type == ps_subscribe_out){
00432                                 if(x->in_object)
00433                                         object_method(x->in_object, ps_unlink_in);
00434                         }
00435                         else if(t->type == ps_subscribe_remote){
00436                                 char temp[32];
00437                                 for(short i=0; i<MAX_NUM_CHANNELS; i++) {
00438                                         snprintf(temp, 32, "__meter__%i", i);
00439                                         if(t->name == gensym(temp)) {
00440                                                 if(x->out_object)
00441                                                         object_method(x->out_object, gensym("remove_meters"));
00442                                         }
00443                                 }
00444                         }
00445                         item = subscribers->erase(item);
00446                         sysmem_freeptr(t);
00447                         
00448                         // TODO: Does the following note from Dave apply anymore now that we use GCC on Windows? [TAP]
00454                         if(item == subscribers->end())
00455                                 break;
00456 
00457                 }
00458         }
00459         // TODO: We really need to use our own mutex instead of the global critical region [TAP]
00460         critical_exit(0);
00461 }
00462 
00463 
00464 // Receive parameter values from jcom.parameter
00465 void hub_receive(t_hub *x, t_symbol *name, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00466 {
00467         char            namestring[256];
00468         t_symbol        *osc;
00469         
00470         strcpy(namestring, "/");                                                // perhaps we could optimize this operation
00471 // TODO: Why is this safety check removed?  Is it really safe to remove it? [TAP]
00472 //      if(argv->a_type == A_SYM)
00473         strcat(namestring, argv->a_w.w_sym->s_name);    //      by creating a table when the param is bound
00474         //strcat(namestring, name->s_name);
00475         osc = gensym(namestring);                                               //      then we could look-up the symbol instead of using gensym()
00476 
00477         if(x->in_object != NULL)
00478                 object_method_typed(x->in_object, ps_algorithm_message, argc, argv, NULL);      // send to jcom.in
00479         if(x->out_object != NULL)
00480                 object_method_typed(x->out_object, ps_algorithm_message, argc, argv, NULL);     // send to jcom.out
00481 
00482         hub_outlet_return(x, osc, argc-1, argv+1);
00483 }
00484 
00485 
00486 // Receive private messages from jcom.remote
00487 void hub_private(t_hub *x, t_symbol *name, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00488 {
00489         t_symbol                *private_id = _sym_nothing;     
00490         t_symbol                *private_message = _sym_nothing;
00491         t_symbol                *userpath = _sym_nothing;
00492         long                    n = 0;
00493         
00494         private_id = atom_getsym(argv);
00495         argc--;
00496         argv++;
00497         private_message = atom_getsym(argv);
00498         argc--;
00499         argv++;
00500         if(private_id == ps__gui__){
00501                 if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_default)                   //      /preset/default
00502                         hub_preset_default(x);
00503                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_load)                 //      /preset/load
00504                         hub_preset_read(x, userpath);
00505                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_recall)               //      /preset/load
00506                         hub_preset_recall(x, _sym_list, 1, argv);
00507                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_store)
00508                         hub_preset_store(x, _sym_list, argc, argv);
00509                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_storenext) 
00510                         hub_preset_store_next(x, _sym_list, argc, argv);
00511                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_copy)         //      /preset/load
00512                         hub_preset_copy(x, _sym_list, argc, argv);
00513                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_preset_slash_write)                        //      /preset/save
00514                         hub_preset_write(x, userpath);
00515                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_module_view_internals)             //      /module/view_internals
00516                         hub_module_view_alg(x);
00517                 else if (private_message == ps_slash_ui_slash_freeze) {                 //      /ui/freeze
00518                         if (argc>0)
00519                                 n = atom_getlong(argv);
00520                         hub_ui_freeze(x, n);
00521                 }
00522                 else if ( private_message == ps_slash_ui_slash_refresh )                //      /ui/refresh
00523                         hub_ui_refresh(x);
00524                 else
00525                         hub_symbol(x, private_message, argc, argv);
00526         }
00527 }
00528 
00529 
00530 // Receive messages from jcom.return - don't send messages back to the algorithm
00531 void hub_return(t_hub *x, t_symbol *name, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00532 {
00533         char            namestring[256];
00534         t_symbol        *osc;
00535         
00536         strcpy(namestring, "/");                                                // perhaps we could optimize this operation
00537         strcat(namestring, argv->a_w.w_sym->s_name);    //      by creating a table when the param is bound
00538         osc = gensym(namestring);                                               //      then we could look-up the symbol instead of using gensym()
00539         hub_outlet_return(x, osc, argc-1, argv+1);
00540 }
00541 
00542 
00543 // A version of the above that performs wilcard substitution
00544 void hub_return_extended(t_hub *x, t_symbol *name, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00545 {
00546         char            namestring[256];
00547         t_symbol        *osc;
00548         
00549         strcpy(namestring, "/");                                                // perhaps we could optimize this operation
00550         strcat(namestring, argv->a_w.w_sym->s_name);    //      by creating a table when the param is bound
00551         if(namestring[strlen(namestring)-1] == '*'){
00552                 namestring[strlen(namestring)-1] = 0;
00553                 if(argv[1].a_type == A_LONG)
00554                         sprintf(namestring, "%s%ld", namestring, argv[1].a_w.w_long);
00555                 else if(argv[1].a_type == A_FLOAT)
00556                         sprintf(namestring, "%s%f", namestring, argv[1].a_w.w_float);
00557                 else // assuming symbol
00558                         strcat(namestring, atom_getsym(argv+1)->s_name);
00559                 osc = gensym(namestring);                                               //      then we could look-up the symbol instead of using gensym()
00560                 hub_outlet_return(x, osc, argc-2, argv+2);              
00561         }
00562         else{
00563                 osc = gensym(namestring);                                               //      then we could look-up the symbol instead of using gensym()
00564                 hub_outlet_return(x, osc, argc-1, argv+1);
00565         }
00566 }
00567 
00568 
00569 // All messages being returned from the module should be funneled through this function!
00570 void hub_outlet_return(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00571 {
00572         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_return], msg, argc, argv);
00573 
00574         if(x->osc_name == NULL)                                 // it's possible for this method to be called before osc_name is valid
00575                 return;                                                         //      ...
00576         if(x->jcom_send){
00577                 char            mess[256];
00578                 t_symbol        *osc;
00579                 
00580                 strcpy(mess, x->osc_name->s_name);
00581                 strcat(mess, msg->s_name);
00582                 osc = gensym(mess);
00583                 object_method_typed(x->jcom_send, osc, argc, argv, NULL);
00584         }
00585 }

00588 t_symbol *hub_modulename_get(t_hub *x)
00589 {
00590         t_atom  a;
00591 
00592         if(x->osc_name != NULL){
00593                 if(x->osc_name != _sym_nothing){
00594                         atom_setsym(&a, x->osc_name);   
00595                         hub_outlet_return(x, gensym("/module_name"), 1, &a);
00596                 }
00597         }
00598         return x->attr_name;
00599 }

00613 
00614 void hub_init(t_hub *x)
00615 {
00616         subscriberList  *subscriber = x->subscriber;
00617         subscriberIterator i;
00618                 
00619         // Search the linked list for jcom.init objects and 'bang' them
00620         critical_enter(0);
00621         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00622                 if((*i)->type == ps_subscribe_init)
00623                         object_method((*i)->object, ps_go);             // TODO: This is an exceptionally bad thing to do inside of the critical region
00624                                                                                                         // It could result in a deadlock
00625         }
00626         
00627         critical_exit(0);
00628         defer_low(x, (method)hub_preset_default, 0, 0, 0L);
00629 }
00630 
00631 
00632 // send a local jcom.init message for the module
00633 void hub_qfn_init(t_hub *x)
00634 {
00635         hub_gui_build(x);                                                       // immediately set up the GUI
00636         defer_low(x, (method)hub_init, 0, 0, 0);        // defer the rest of the initialization
00637 }

00640 // send info to gui constructor
00641 void hub_gui_build(t_hub *x)
00642 {
00643         subscriberList  *subscriber = x->subscriber;
00644 
00645         if(x->gui_object != NULL){
00646                 t_atom a[3];
00647                 
00648                 atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_ATTRIBUTES);
00649                 if(x->attr_size){
00650                         atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_size);
00651                         atom_setsym(&a[2], x->attr_size);
00652                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 3, a, NULL);
00653                 }
00654                 if(x->attr_inspector){
00655                         atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_inspector);
00656                         atom_setlong(&a[2], x->attr_inspector);
00657                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 3, a, NULL);
00658                 }
00659                 if(x->attr_algorithm_type){
00660                         atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_algorithm_type);
00661                         atom_setsym(&a[2], x->attr_algorithm_type);
00662                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 3, a, NULL);
00663                 }
00664                 if(x->attr_type){
00665                         atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_module_type);
00666                         atom_setsym(&a[2], x->attr_type);
00667                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 3, a, NULL);
00668                 }
00669                 if(x->attr_skin){
00670                         atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_skin);
00671                         atom_setsym(&a[2], x->attr_skin);
00672                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 3, a, NULL);
00673                 }
00674                 if(x->osc_name){
00675                         atom_setsym(&a[1], ps_MODULE_TITLE);
00676                         atom_setsym(&a[2], x->osc_name);
00677                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 3, a, NULL);
00678                 }
00679                 if(x->attr_name){
00680                         atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_MODULE_NAME);
00681                         atom_setsym(&a[1], x->attr_name);
00682                         object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 2, a, NULL);                  
00683                 }
00684                 
00685                 subscriberIterator i;
00686                 t_subscriber* t;
00687                 critical_enter(0);
00688                 for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00689                         t = *i;
00690                         if((t->type == ps_subscribe_message) || t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter){
00691                                 atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_PARAMETER);
00692                                 atom_setsym(&a[1], t->name);
00693                                 object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 2, a, NULL);                  
00694                         }
00695                 }
00696                 critical_exit(0);
00697 
00698                 atom_setsym(&a[0], ps_BUILD);           
00699                 object_method_typed(x->gui_object, ps_dispatched, 1, a, NULL);
00700         }
00701 }

00707 // Method for Assistance Messages
00708 void hub_assist(t_hub *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00709 {
00710         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00711                 strcpy(dst, "input");
00712         else{                                                   // Outlets
00713                 switch(arg){
00714                         case k_outlet_return:
00715                                         strcpy(dst, "return: connect to return outlet");
00716                                         break;
00717                         case k_outlet_dumpout:
00718                                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00719                                         break;
00720                 }
00721         }               
00722 }

00745 // Return a list of parameters and message for this module
00746 void hub_paramnames_get(t_hub *x)
00747 {
00748         subscriberList  *subscriber = x->subscriber;    // head of the linked list
00749         t_atom                  a;
00750         
00751         hub_outlet_return(x, ps_parameter_names_start, 0, NULL);
00752         
00753         subscriberIterator i;
00754         t_subscriber* t;
00755         critical_enter(0);
00756         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00757                 t = *i;
00758                 atom_setsym(&a, t->name);
00759                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter)
00760                         hub_outlet_return(x, ps_parameter_name, 1, &a);
00761         }
00762         critical_exit(0);
00763         hub_outlet_return(x, ps_parameter_names_end, 0, NULL);
00764 }

00767 // Return a list of parameters and message for this module
00768 void hub_paramvalues_get(t_hub *x)
00769 {
00770         subscriberList  *subscriber = x->subscriber;    // head of the linked list
00771         t_atom                  *av;
00772         long                    ac;
00773         char                    osc[512];
00774         
00775         hub_outlet_return(x, ps_parameter_values_start, 0, NULL);
00776         
00777         subscriberIterator i;
00778         t_subscriber* t;
00779         critical_enter(0);
00780         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00781                 t = *i;
00782                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter){
00783                         ac = NULL; av = NULL;                                                                           // init
00784                         object_attr_getvalueof(t->object, ps_value, &ac, &av);          // get  
00785                         sprintf(osc, "%s/%s", ps_parameter_value->s_name, t->name->s_name);
00786                         hub_outlet_return(x, gensym(osc), ac, av);
00787                 }
00788         }
00789                 
00790         critical_exit(0);
00791         hub_outlet_return(x, ps_parameter_values_end, 0, NULL);
00792 }

00845 
00846 // SYMBOL INPUT
00847 void hub_symbol(t_hub *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00848 {
00849         bool                    found = false;
00850         subscriberList  *subscriber = x->subscriber;
00851         char                    input[MAX_STRING_LEN];  // our input string
00852         char                    *input2 = input;                // pointer to our input string
00853         char                    *split;
00854         t_symbol                *osc = NULL;
00855         t_symbol                *name = msg;                    // default to the name being the message
00856 
00857         strcpy(input, msg->s_name);
00858         if(*input2 == '/')                              // leading slash means it's OSC...
00859                 input2++;                                       // remove the the leading slash
00860 
00861         split = strchr(input2, ':');    // remove (and store) the param name
00862         if(split != NULL){
00863                 *split = NULL;
00864                 split++;                                        // now input2 = param name; split = a message for the parameter object          
00865                 osc = gensym(split);
00866         }
00867         name = gensym(input2);
00868 
00869         subscriberIterator i;
00870         t_subscriber* t;
00871         critical_enter(0);
00872         if(name == ps_star){                    // wildcard
00873                 t_symbol* type;
00874                 for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00875                         t = *i; type = t->type;
00876                         if(type == ps_subscribe_parameter 
00877                           || type == ps_subscribe_message 
00878                           || type == ps_subscribe_return){
00879                                 if(osc == NULL){
00880                                         object_method_typed(t->object, ps_dispatched, argc, argv, NULL);
00881                                 }
00882                                 else{
00883                                         object_method_typed(t->object, osc, argc, argv, NULL);
00884                                 }
00885                         }
00886                 }
00887         }
00888         else{
00889                 
00890                 // search the linked list of params to find the right one
00891                 for(i = subscriber->begin(); (i != subscriber->end()) && (found == false); ++i) {
00892                         t = *i; 
00893                         if(t->name == name) {
00894                                 found = true;
00895                                 break;
00896                         }
00897                 }
00898 
00899                 // dispatch to the correct jcom.param object
00900                 if(found == true){
00901                         if(osc == NULL){
00902                                 object_method_typed(t->object, ps_dispatched, argc, argv, NULL);
00903                         }
00904                         else
00905                                 object_method_typed(t->object, osc, argc, argv, NULL);
00906                 }
00907                 else{
00908                         // Check to see if it's a message we need to forward to jcom.out
00909                         if(name == ps_slash_audio_meters_freeze || name == ps_audio_meters_freeze) {
00910                                 t_atom msg[2];
00911                                 atom_setsym(msg, name);
00912                                 jcom_core_atom_copy(msg+1, argv);
00913                                 if(x->out_object != NULL)
00914                                         object_method_typed(x->out_object, ps_algorithm_message, 2, msg, NULL); 
00915                         } else if(!x->using_wildcard) {
00916                                 // if we got here through the use a remote message to modules named by a wildcard
00917                                 // then we need don't post annoying errors to the Max window
00918                                 if (x->osc_name == gensym("/editing_this_module"))
00919                                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->attr_name->s_name);
00920                                 else    
00921                                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->osc_name->s_name);
00922                                 error("No message or parameter named %s.", name->s_name);
00923                         }
00924                 }
00925         }
00926         critical_exit(0);
00927 }
00928 
00929 
00930 void hub_module_view_alg(t_hub *x)
00931 {
00932         if(x->in_object != NULL)
00933                 object_method_typed(x->in_object, ps_open, 0, 0L, NULL);                                        // send "open" to jcom.in
00934         hub_outlet_return(x, ps_slash_module_view_internals, 0, 0L);                                    // return from jcom.hub left outlet
00935 }

00938 // FREEZE UI for all parameters
00939 void hub_ui_freeze(t_hub *x, long val)
00940 {
00941         subscriberList *subscriber = x->subscriber;     // head of the linked list
00942         t_atom a;
00943 
00944         atom_setlong(&a, val);  
00945         
00946         // Update stored parameter value for module/freeze
00947         hub_symbol(x, ps_ui_slash_freeze, 1, &a);
00948         
00949         // Change freeze status for all messages and parameters 
00950         subscriberIterator i;
00951         t_subscriber* t;
00952         critical_enter(0);
00953         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00954                 t = *i;
00955                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter)
00956                         object_method_typed(t->object, ps_ui_slash_freeze, 1, &a, NULL);
00957         }
00958         critical_exit(0);
00959 }

00962 // REFRESH UI for all parameters
00963 void hub_ui_refresh(t_hub *x)
00964 {
00965         subscriberList *subscriber = x->subscriber;     // head of the linked list
00966         
00967         subscriberIterator i;
00968         t_subscriber* t;
00969         critical_enter(0);
00970         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
00971                 t = *i;
00972                 if(t->type == ps_subscribe_parameter)
00973                         object_method_typed(t->object, ps_ui_slash_refresh, 0, 0L, NULL);
00974         }
00975         critical_exit(0);
00976 }
00977 
00978 
00979 // receive messages from our internal jcom.receive external
00980 void hub_receive_callback(void *z, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00981 {
00982         t_hub           *x = (t_hub *)z;
00983         char            mess[256];
00984         char            *in = &mess[0];
00985         char            *split;
00986         t_symbol        *osc;
00987         
00988         strcpy(mess, msg->s_name);
00989         if(*in == '/')                                  // remove leading slash...
00990                 in++;
00991                 
00992         split = strchr(in, '/');                // get the OSC message for the module
00993         if(split == NULL){
00994                 if (x->osc_name == gensym("/editing_this_module"))
00995                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->attr_name->s_name);
00996                 else    
00997                         post("Jamoma: Module %s complains:", x->osc_name->s_name);
00998                 error("jcom.hub (%s module) received message from jcom.send with problematic or missing OSC namespace (%s)", x->attr_name->s_name, mess);
00999                 return;
01000         }
01001 
01002         *split = 0;                                             
01003         
01004         if(*in == '*'){                                                                         // wildcard
01005                 // when parsing wildcards, we need to check and see if there is actually a valid subscriber
01006                 // before blindly sending the message... 
01007                 split++;
01008                 osc = gensym(split);
01009                 x->using_wildcard = true;
01010                 object_method_typed(x, osc, argc, argv, NULL);          // call the method on this hub object
01011                 x->using_wildcard = false;
01012         }
01013         else if(!strcmp(mess, x->osc_name->s_name)){            // check if we are the correct module...
01014                 split++;
01015                 osc = gensym(split);
01016                 object_method_typed(x, osc, argc, argv, NULL);          // call the method on this hub object
01017         }
01018 }
01019 
01020 
01021 
01022 // 'bang' method for user input
01023 void hub_bang(t_hub *x)
01024 {       
01025         t_atom                          a;
01026         subscriberIterator      i;
01027         t_subscriber            *t;
01028         t_symbol                        *type;
01029         
01030         for(i = subscriber->begin(); i != subscriber->end(); ++i) {
01031                 t = *i; 
01032                 type = t->type;
01033                 
01034                 if(type == ps_subscribe_parameter || type == ps_subscribe_message){
01035                         if(osc == NULL)
01036                                 object_method(t->object, gensym("/ramp/update"));
01037                 }
01038         }       
01039 }
